text: Santos René Núñez Téllez (died 2016) was a Nicaraguan politician. He was a Sandinista revolutionary and later President of the National Assembly of Nicaragua. He became a deputy in the National Assembly in 2002 and served as its President in 2005 and then again from 2007 until his death in 2016. Born in Leon, Nicaragua, Núñez was the brother of Carlos Núñez; together they joined the Sandinista effort in 1969 and in 1975, René Núñez was sentenced to eight years in prison for his guerilla efforts. After the Sandinistas defeated the Somoza regime in 1979, he took on new roles in the government as well as the Sandinista party (FSLN). Núñez died September 10, 2016 in San José, Costa Rica, where he was seeking medical care. ==References== Category:Presidents of the National Assembly (Nicaragua) Category:Sandinista National Liberation Front politicians Category:2016 deaths Category:Members of the National Assembly (Nicaragua) Category:People from León, Nicaragua
title: René Núñez Téllez
